Question: Why was this treatise composed?
Answer: In order to stop those who deny the existence of possession and non-possession, to show that possession and non-possession are real existences, this treatise was composed.

Question: As for those who follow faith and so on, regarding the four meditations and four formless attainments associated with relishing,
how many do they accomplish and how many do they not accomplish?
Answer: As for those who follow faith, regarding the four meditations associated with relishing,
they may have none, one, two, three, or four.
None means those who have ended craving for the form realm. At the time of detachment from that, they have all already been eliminated.
One means those who have ended craving for the heaven of universal purity but have not yet ended craving for higher realms.
They only accomplish the meditation and formless attainment of the highest level.
Two means those who have ended craving for the heaven of extreme radiance but have not yet ended craving for higher realms.
They only accomplish the two higher meditation and formless attainments.
Three means those who have ended craving for the Brahma heaven but have not yet ended craving for higher realms.
They only accomplish the three higher meditation and formless attainments.
The fourth is when the desire for the Brahma world has not yet been eliminated.
They all possess the four dhyanas and the desire for the lower realms has not yet been eliminated. They must possess the desire for the higher realms.
When the desire for the lower realms has already been eliminated, they definitely do not possess the desire for the lower realms.
In the pure four dhyanas, they may have none, or one, two, three, or four.
None means when the desire for the desire realm has not yet been eliminated, they have not yet attained any of the pure dhyanas.
One means when the desire for the desire realm has been eliminated but the desire for the higher realms has not yet been eliminated.
They possess the pure [dhyana] of the lower realm.
Two means when the desire for the Brahma world has been eliminated but the desire for the higher realms has not yet been eliminated.
They only possess the pure [dhyanas] of the lower two realms.
Three means when the desire for the extreme radiance has been eliminated but the desire for the higher realms has not yet been eliminated.
They only possess the pure [dhyanas] of the lower two realms.
Four means when the desire for the pure has been eliminated.
They fully possess the pure [dhyanas] of the four realms.
When the desire for the lower realms has not yet been eliminated, they definitely do not possess the pure [dhyana] of the higher realms.
When the desire for the higher realms has already been eliminated and the body is in the lower realms,
they definitely possess the pure [dhyana] of the lower realms.
Because one who practices according to faith must be in the desire realm, this is said.
In the four formless concentrations, one may have none, one, two, three, or four.
None means one who enters the correct state of detachment through the concentration of the preliminary stage.
In this case, one may not yet be free from the passions of the desire realm,
or even if one is free from the passions of the desire realm, one may not be able to cultivate them, so one does not accomplish any.
One means one who enters the correct state of detachment through the first concentration or the intermediate concentration.
They accomplish one stage of undefiled concentration but not the others.
Either they have not yet attained it or they are unable to cultivate it.
Two means one who enters the correct state of detachment through the second concentration.
They accomplish the two lower stages of undefiled concentration but not the others, as explained above.
Three means one who enters the correct state of detachment through the third concentration.
They accomplish the three lower stages of undefiled concentration.
Not the others, as explained above.
Four means one who enters the correct state of detachment through the fourth concentration.
They have already attained and are able to cultivate the four undefiled meditations.
The path of seeing necessarily does not cultivate the higher stages based on the lower stages.
Because it is the first attainment of the path.
The undefiled [path] necessarily cultivates the lower stages based on the higher stages because it is free and unattached.
